alert.note: Alert for Paradox Valley, Lower Dolores River; Uncompahgre Plateau, Dallas Divide (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 7:18PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Mesa County through 745 PM MDT... At 717 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 21 miles northwest of Nucla, or 32 miles northeast of La Sal, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Mesa County. This includes Colorado 141 between mile markers 127 and 137. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Paradox Valley, Lower Dolores River; Uncompahgre Plateau, Dallas Divide
